alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 12:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN CAMDEN...AND CURRITUCK COUNTIES AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 1201 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Indiantown, or 8 miles northwest of Grandy, moving north at 25 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph and locally heavy downpours are possible with this storm. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Old Trap, Indiantown, Moyock, Knotts Island, Shiloh, Poplar Branch, Snowden, Aydlett, Gregory, Munden, Barco, Coinjock, Riddle, Waterlily, Bertha, Goose Creek, Sligo and Bartlett. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
